title: Retirement visa (subclass 410)
summary: This page provides detailed information about the Retirement visa (subclass 410), which is closed to new applicants and only available to specific existing or former holders. It outlines what the visa allows, eligibility rules, costs, health and character requirements, and other important considerations for renewing or maintaining this visa.

availability: Existing Retirement visa (subclass 410) holders and their partners
Former Retirement visa (subclass 410) holders and their partners who have not held another substantive visa since last entering Australia
not_eligible: Former Retirement visa holders and partners who have been granted any other substantive visa (including Visitor visas and Electronic Travel Authorities)
visa_details.description: A temporary visa for retirees and their partners who want to spend retirement years in Australia. Does not lead to permanent residence or citizenship.
visa_details.travel_rights: Can leave and re-enter Australia at any time

permanent_residence_pathway.description: Pathway to permanent residence for retirement visa holders announced in the 2018-19 Budget.

notes: Notify the Department if passport changes after visa grant
Failure to provide updated passport details may cause airport delays or denial of boarding

government_benefits.medicare_eligibility: Generally not eligible, including under Reciprocal Health Care Agreements

definitions.rollover: To renew a Retirement visa to allow further stay
definitions.partner: Spouse or de facto partner (including same-sex partners)
substantive_visa: Any visa except a bridging visa

adequate_coverage_definition: Covers at least 85% of costs for hospital, emergency and GP services
health_insurance_requirements.overseas_insurer_policy: Accepted but requires detailed examination and may cause delays
health_insurance_requirements.consequence_of_failure: Possible refusal of future visa applications

payment_methods: Bank cheque payable to the Department of Home Affairs
Money order payable to the Department of Home Affairs

compelling_and_compassionate_circumstanc.description: Alternative criteria may apply to applicants in Australia who cannot meet certain visa criteria due to hardship.
examples: Difficulties following the death of a partner
compelling_and_compassionate_circumstanc.process: Department may request additional information after application

who_can_apply: Existing Retirement visa holders and their partners
Former Retirement visa holders and their partners who have not held another substantive visa since last entering Australia

health_requirements.examination_required: Only if applicant has travelled for 3 months or more to a high-risk tuberculosis country
health_requirements.if_tb_identified: Medical treatment likely, rather than visa refusal

required_documents: Overseas penal clearance for every country lived in for at least 12 months since last Retirement visa grant
timing_notes: Clearances preferred at time of application
If current visa is about to expire, proof of application for clearances may be submitted instead
character_requirements.processing_note: Providing clearances later may delay processing
